definitions.definition: a religious ceremony or act of the Christian Church that is regarded as an outward and visible sign of inward and spiritual divine grace, in particular.
(in the Roman Catholic and many Orthodox Churches) the rites of baptism, confirmation, the Eucharist, penance, anointing of the sick, ordination, and matrimony.
(in Roman Catholic use) the consecrated elements of the Eucharist, especially the Host.
examples: noun: Blessed Sacrament; noun: Holy Sacrament; noun: the Blessed Sacrament

definitions.definition: a thing of mysterious and sacred significance; a religious symbol.
